play

Interface PlayStrategyInterface


  • public interface PlayStrategyInterface
    This class represents a game strategy for a single round. It is used to pass information between the game engine and the strategy developed to play that game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getFinalP1Node()
      Exposes the (unique) index of the terminal node in the game tree where the latest round of the game terminated when this player was acting as player 1 (i.e, challenger)
      int getFinalP2Node()
      Exposes the (unique) index of the terminal node in the game tree where the latest round of the game terminated when this player was acting as player 2 (i.e, challenged)
      int getLastRoundOpponentScoreAsP1(GameTree t)
      Exposes the score of the opponent in the latest round when the current player was playing as P1.
      int getLastRoundOpponentScoreAsP2(GameTree t)
      Exposes the score of the opponent in the latest round when the current player was playing as P2.
      int getLastRoundSelfScoreAsP1(GameTree t)
      Exposes the score of the current player in the latest round when playing as P1.
      int getLastRoundSelfScoreAsP2(GameTree t)
      Exposes the score of the current player in the latest round when playing as P2.
      int getMaximumNumberOfIterations()
      Returns the maximum number of iterations of the current game.
      boolean isFirstRound()
      Reports if the current round is the first round of a game.
      java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> keyIterator()
      Returns an ordered iterator that enables iteration over the labels for the information sets associated with the current game.
      double probabilityForNextIteration()
      Returns the probability to continue to the next iteration (assuming next iteration is below @getMaximumNumberOfIterations()).
      java.lang.Double put(java.lang.String key, java.lang.Double value)
      Updates the probability value associated with following the game branch associated with the information set denoted by the @key to @value.
      void quitGame()
      This method should be executed to notify the engine of the game that the player is quitting the game (this will lead the player to lose the game).
      long timeToExpire()
      Obtains the approximate amount of milliseconds until the timeout of the current round.

    • Method Detail

      • timeToExpire

        long timeToExpire()
        Obtains the approximate amount of milliseconds until the timeout of the current round.
        Returns:
        the approximate amount of milliseconds until the player has to provide the next play. Notice that consulting this method will make you lose some time, and also that the strategy must be delivered in time so that it can be transmitted to the server within this bound (which takes at most a few hundreds of milliseconds).

      • probabilityForNextIteration

        double probabilityForNextIteration()
        Returns the probability to continue to the next iteration (assuming next iteration is below @getMaximumNumberOfIterations()).
        Returns:
        the probability to continue

      • getMaximumNumberOfIterations

        int getMaximumNumberOfIterations()
        Returns the maximum number of iterations of the current game.
        Returns:
        the maximum number of iterations

      • isFirstRound

        boolean isFirstRound()
        Reports if the current round is the first round of a game.
        Returns:
        true if the current round is the first round, false otherwise.

      • quitGame

        void quitGame()
        This method should be executed to notify the engine of the game that the player is quitting the game (this will lead the player to lose the game). After executing this method the instance of PlayStraegy must be delivered to the game engine.

      • put

        java.lang.Double put(java.lang.String key,
                     java.lang.Double value)
        Updates the probability value associated with following the game branch associated with the information set denoted by the @key to @value.
        Parameters:
        key - The label for the information set of the node.
        value - Probability, must be a value between 0 and 1.
        Returns:

      • keyIterator

        java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> keyIterator()
        Returns an ordered iterator that enables iteration over the labels for the information sets associated with the current game.
        Returns:
        an iterator of type String with the labels associated with the information sets of this game.

      • getFinalP1Node

        int getFinalP1Node()
        Exposes the (unique) index of the terminal node in the game tree where the latest round of the game terminated when this player was acting as player 1 (i.e, challenger)
        Returns:
        unique positive index of the terminal node, -1 if there was no round in the game before.

      • getFinalP2Node

        int getFinalP2Node()
        Exposes the (unique) index of the terminal node in the game tree where the latest round of the game terminated when this player was acting as player 2 (i.e, challenged)
        Returns:
        unique positive index of the terminal node, -1 if there was no round in the game before.

      • getLastRoundSelfScoreAsP1

        int getLastRoundSelfScoreAsP1(GameTree t)
        Exposes the score of the current player in the latest round when playing as P1. The return of this method in the first round is not specified.
        Parameters:
        t - the GameTree for the current game
        Returns:
        current player current score in the previous round as player 1.

      • getLastRoundSelfScoreAsP2

        int getLastRoundSelfScoreAsP2(GameTree t)
        Exposes the score of the current player in the latest round when playing as P2. The return of this method in the first round is not specified.\
        Parameters:
        t - the GameTree for the current game
        Returns:
        current player current score in the previous round as player 2.

      • getLastRoundOpponentScoreAsP1

        int getLastRoundOpponentScoreAsP1(GameTree t)
        Exposes the score of the opponent in the latest round when the current player was playing as P1. The return of this method in the first round is not specified.
        Parameters:
        t - the GameTree for the current game
        Returns:
        opponent score in the previous round when the the current player was playing as player 1.

      • getLastRoundOpponentScoreAsP2

        int getLastRoundOpponentScoreAsP2(GameTree t)
        Exposes the score of the opponent in the latest round when the current player was playing as P2. The return of this method in the first round is not specified.
        Parameters:
        t - the GameTree for the current game
        Returns:
        opponent score in the previous round when the the current player was playing as player 2.
